intro: Marrubium guilliermondii, commonly known as the Canary Island horehound, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its gray-green foliage and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. It typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Marrubium guilliermondii is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
